adjective.description: (of an action or thing) done or operating in an impressively smooth, efficient, and apparently effortless way.
(of skin or hair) smooth and glossy.
examples: a dandy-looking dude with a slick black ponytail

noun.description: A small smear or patch of a glossy or wet substance, especially a cosmetic.
A race car or bicycle tire without a tread, for use in dry weather conditions.
A person who is smooth and persuasive but untrustworthy.

verb.description: Make (one's hair) flat, smooth, and glossy by applying water, oil, or cream to it.
examples: his damp hair was slicked back

verb.description: Make someone or something smart, tidy, or stylish.

origin: Middle English (in the senses glossy and make smooth or glossy): probably from Old English and related to Old Norse sl√≠kr smooth; compare with sleek.
